#Text=Embed Pictures
#Text=Photos and other graphical images add interest to web pages and printed materials with a minimum of effort .
#Text=Embedding pictures into your written text is quick and easy , although the process differs greatly depending on the application you are using .
#Text=It is possible to embed pictures and other graphical images in Word , PowerPoint , Wordpress and HTML .
#Text=Start with step 1 to get graphic !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Word and PowerPoint
#Text=Choose the type of embedded image .
#Text=You can add a picture or insert a graphic , clip art or chart .
#Text=You can also create a shape or graphic .
#Text=Click the Insert tab and then click the icon for the image type .
#Text=Clicking the Picture icon will launch the " Insert Picture " window .

column1: #Text=You can search for a piece of clip art or browse through the catalog .
#Text=Click on your clip art to select it and it will appear in your document .
#Text=Choosing the " Smart Art " icon causes a window to pop up where you can select your Smart Art image and insert it into your document .
#Text=Customize the image after it has been placed into your Word document .
#Text=Wordpress
#Text=Place your cursor in the draft of your blog post or page where you want to upload image .
#Text=Upload the image by clicking the " Add an Image " icon above the text entry field .
#Text=You can choose to upload images from your computer or from an existing URL .
#Text=You can also choose to insert an image you have already saved in your Media Library .
#Text=Select the appropriate tab for your upload image source .
#Text=If uploading from your computer , browse to the image and click " OK .

column1: #Text=If you are linking to someone else 's image , make sure to obtain permission from the owner. .
#Text=HTML
#Text=Upload the image you would like to embed in your web page using an FTP utility .
#Text=Create the image tag by using the < img src="URL " alt="alternate text " / > syntax .

column1: #Text=The words " alternat_text " should be replaced with the text that will be displayed on browsers not capable of showing the im age .
#Text=For example , your image tag may read < img src="picture1 . jp " alt="picture_ of_boat " / >
